body_html: It would be interesting to find out more about how the OS can play any role here. After all, the floating-point control word is a CPU feature, not an OS feature. There have been cases where OSes or drivers still managed to corrupt such CPU state by means of interrupts, or alternatively, one could imagine that some OS might have a buggy implementation of saving/restoring registers in context-switches... it would be interesting to find that out.
